use-ttw: I read and post in this community
use-mailing-list: I read/lurk, but do not post
use-reddit: I read/lurk, but do not post
use-discord: I do not engage with this community
use-github-discuss: I read/lurk, but do not post
main-use-cases: Note-taking;Task and project management (including CRMs);As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content);Other
other-use-cases: Planning lessons and courses for university students
share-wikis: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
value-of-tw: A great deal of value: it is my main store of information, and a key thinking tool I use at least most days.
tw-ability-level: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I am comfortable writing filter expressions;I have written custom HTML;I have written custom CSS styles
save-method: Single-file wiki with custom saver (e.g. TiddlyPWA, Timimi, tw5-browser-nativesaver);Multi-file wiki served through Node.js
backup-method: Consumer online storage (e.g. Google Drive, Dropbox);DIY (any other solution)

tw-customisations:
- quite heavily adapted Projectify plugin for more helpful project management for me
- adapted Gruvbox dark palette (more accessible code colours and some other minor differences
- custom CSS 
- adapted RefNotes and BibTex importer plugins
project-strengths:
- Super helpful community on talk.tiddlywiki
- Regular updates and information about possible future updates
- I pure love wikitext syntax for formatting text etc.
- runs in a browser
- it's a Quine
- incredibly adaptable 
- very powerful wikitext (language)
project-weaknesses:
- I wish I were better able to grasp key aspects of widgets / parameters / functions from the official documentation (e.g., I have been making a new project manager for about 2 years and still haven't finished it, in part because I don't fully understand what I am doing, or what could work best)
- I am worried my main wiki is starting to slow slightly as it grows (currently >20Mb in size, just from text notes, SVG icons, etc.) and would like it to be able to easily handle far larger sizes
ok-to-publish: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
title: Community Survey 2025 Answer 00100
